angstd.ui.docking
Class AngstdDesktop

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JLayeredPane
                  com.vlsolutions.swing.docking.DockingDesktop
                      angstd.ui.docking.AngstdDesktop
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class AngstdDesktop
extends com.vlsolutions.swing.docking.DockingDesktop

The Angstd docking desktop uses the external library VLDocking to arrange the main frame components such as the workspace or views.

An extended version of the VLDocking DockableContainerFactory (@link SDockableContainerFactory) as well as an extended version of the VLDocking Dockkey (@link SDockkey) is used to introduce a visibility flag for title bars. Therefore it is possible to display the view desktop virtually without title bar.

The desktop can be split into two parts. First a data desktop which may contain the workspace and additional components like a logger. Second the view desktop holding the last added view.

A DefaultDockableResolver creates the dockable components for backend components like a workspace view, which are then added to the corresponding desktop.

The actual adding, removing and name change for views is done by the desktop, but accessed in AngstdUI which works as wrapper for those methods.

Author:
Andreas Held
See Also:
